body:
Changes made. Thanks for the review!

On Fri, Sep 25, 2015 at 11:00 AM, Roberta Marton notifications@github.com
wrote:

> The native table changes look good.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/92#issuecomment-143261222
> .

## 

Regards, --Qifan
I'm guessing the change to runallsb was not intended?

not at all.

On Mon, Sep 28, 2015 at 11:07 AM, DaveBirdsall notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I'm guessing the change to runallsb was not intended?
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/94#issuecomment-143791095
> .

## 

Regards, --Qifan

Hi Dave,

Thanks a lot of the quick review. I have submitted the rework. Please
review.

Thanks --Qifan

On Mon, Sep 28, 2015 at 11:08 AM, Qifan Chen qifan.chen@esgyn.com wrote:

> not at all.
> 
> On Mon, Sep 28, 2015 at 11:07 AM, DaveBirdsall notifications@github.com
> wrote:
> 
> > I'm guessing the change to runallsb was not intended?
> > 
> > â€”
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/94#issuecomment-143791095
> > .
> 
> ## 
> 
> Regards, --Qifan

## 

Regards, --Qifan
The reworked changes look good to me.
Arvind, Steve and Anu: Are we happy with this set of changes now? If so I will commit them.
I see there is an issue with traf_sqconfig (for some reason I had an old version!). Will fix.

Yes Dave - could I try to do this with your help (from office)?

-----Original Message-----
From: "DaveBirdsall" notifications@github.com
Sent: â€Ž9/â€Ž29/â€Ž2015 11:06 AM
To: "apache/incubator-trafodion" incubator-trafodion@noreply.github.com
Cc: "arvind-narain" narain.arvind@gmail.com
Subject: Re: [incubator-trafodion] [TRAFODION-1498] install_local_hadoop failson building DCS due to missing jdbcT4 jar file (#93)

Arvind, Steve and Anu: Are we happy with this set of changes now? If so I will commit them.
â€”
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
Yes. Do you have your apache ID yet?
I do - will check if I have access

Do please check on the dependency site for icu's library suffix. Also will need an update to TOOLSDIR /opt/home/tools accordingly for dev and build systems.

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/TRAFODION/Additional+Build+Tools
Looks good to me. Would be nice to get another pair eyes on this one.
Thank and I'm hoping Roberta can take a look, we discussed this change.
looks good. Do we want to create a separate JIRA for the test failure (PR 179) ? Not related to this change.
Dave could you please merge this change ? Thanks
Thanks for changing this, it looks fine.  I use this same mechanism in privilege manager code so I will check to see if a similar change is required.
Looks good. Thank you. Merging the change.
Since PR tests are failing we should wait till these are resolved to merge this change.
Looks great to me, with two small comments.

Yes, the section of code you mention, Hans, needs more work. That particular code is inherited from Seaquest. It is the part of the code that I understand least well. I will be unit testing it carefully (and perhaps throwing it away and rewriting it) on the next submittal.
Bless you for making this change. You'll save many wrong turns in the future.
Looks good to me. I take it a lot of the removed ODBC stuff is old NSK-isms that are no longer used?
Dave, should we merge this now or would you add more changes to this delivery ?
I will be pushing some reworks up shortly (as soon as a regression run finishes cleanly). Please hold off on merge.
Thanks for fixing these, and I have the feeling that I probably broke the EXPLAIN for UDRs, sorry about that.
Thank you for catching my basic mistake Hans.
Reviewers, any final comments on the reworked code before committing?

Hi Dave,

Can you please send us the URL to the rework?

Thank you. --Qifan

On Wed, Oct 7, 2015 at 1:28 PM, DaveBirdsall notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Reviewers, any final comments on the reworked code before committing?
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/102#issuecomment-146285744
> .

## 

Regards, --Qifan

The rework can be found with the pull request, here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/102. In the Conversation tab, look for my comment, "I will be pushing up some reworks shortly...". Right below that in tiny print you'll see a commit, "Reworks addressing review comments". Click on that.

Hi Dave,

The rework looks good.

I wonder if we should set HBASE_DELETE_COSTING to off by default, and turn
it back on after the performance test.

Thanks -Qifan

On Wed, Oct 7, 2015 at 1:49 PM, DaveBirdsall notifications@github.com
wrote:

> The rework can be found with the pull request, here: #102
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/102. In the
> Conversation tab, look for my comment, "I will be pushing up some reworks
> shortly...". Right below that in tiny print you'll see a commit, "Reworks
> addressing review comments". Click on that.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/102#issuecomment-146291541
> .

## 

Regards, --Qifan

I would prefer to leave HBASE_DELETE_COSTING on, as the off behavior stubs delete cost as 1 for every delete operation (which is obviously very wrong). Early performance testing is yielding good results; I'm seeing good switch over from index access scan on a delete to full table scan as the selectivity of the index predicate rises for example.
Thank you for the review Hans, Dave.

Yes, if we can document evidences of the good plans now being generated in
this email thread, that will be sufficient to leave the CQD on.

We also will need to arrange the performance test.  I'll ask about it,
along with other items on the plate.

Thanks.

On Wed, Oct 7, 2015 at 2:12 PM, DaveBirdsall notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I would prefer to leave HBASE_DELETE_COSTING on, as the off behavior stubs
> delete cost as 1 for every delete operation (which is obviously very
> wrong). Early performance testing is yielding good results; I'm seeing good
> switch over from index access scan on a delete to full table scan as the
> selectivity of the index predicate rises for example.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/102#issuecomment-146298929
> .

## 

Regards, --Qifan
Will publish some test results shortly.

Below is a log of a test of the DELETE costing changes. In this particular test, I'm looking at plan quality. I also attempt some performance tests at the end, though the results here were done on a VM with uncontrolled competing workload and so must be taken with a grain of salt. Some interesting things to note. Near the end of the test, I vary the cardinality of the set of rows being deleted to see when we switch over from using an index scan to a base table scan when deciding which rows to delete. The crossover point is between queries D7000 and D7500. I also execute these DELETEs and capture their execution time statistics. The plan execution times are in the same ballpark, which suggests that the crossover point is reasonable. I was watching with "top" while these DELETEs were running; during the first one there were two competing builds running on the system (hence the higher elapsed time), for the next four only one competing build. Builds vary in their resource use over time so this affected the test times.

> > obey TEST001(setup1);
> > 
> > drop table if exists np001;

--- SQL operation complete.

> > drop table if exists np001backup;

--- SQL operation complete.

> > -- create a non-partitioned table with 16384 rows in it
> > 
> > create table np001
> > +> ( a integer not null,
> > +>   b integer not null,
> > +>   c integer not null,
> > +>   d varchar(100),
> > +>   primary key (a) );

--- SQL operation complete.

> > insert into np001 values (1,1,1,'hi there!'),
> > +>  (2,1,1,'a somewhat longer string'),
> > +>  (3,2,2,'Now is the time for all good men to come to the aid of their country.'),
> > +>  (4,3,3,null);

--- 4 row(s) inserted.

> > insert into np001 select a+4,b+4,c,d from np001;

--- 4 row(s) inserted.

> > insert into np001 select a+8,b+8,c,d from np001;

--- 8 row(s) inserted.

> > insert into np001 select a+16,b+16,c,d from np001;

--- 16 row(s) inserted.

> > insert into np001 select a+32,b+32,c,d from np001;

--- 32 row(s) inserted.

> > insert into np001 select a+64,b+64,c,d from np001;

--- 64 row(s) inserted.

> > insert into np001 select a+128,b+128,c,d from np001;

--- 128 row(s) inserted.

> > insert into np001 select a+256,b+256,c,d from np001;

--- 256 row(s) inserted.

> > insert into np001 select a+512,b+512,c,d from np001;

--- 512 row(s) inserted.

> > upsert into np001 select a+1024,b+1024,c,d from np001;

--- 1024 row(s) inserted.

> > upsert into np001 select a+2048,b+2048,c,d from np001;

--- 2048 row(s) inserted.

> > upsert into np001 select a+4096,b+4096,c,d from np001;

--- 4096 row(s) inserted.

> > upsert into np001 select a+8192,b+8192,c,d from np001;

--- 8192 row(s) inserted.

> > -- turn off histogram caching so we'll get the right histograms afterward
> > cqd cache_histograms 'OFF';

--- SQL operation complete.

> > update statistics for table np001 on every column;

--- SQL operation complete.

> > cqd cache_histograms reset;

--- SQL operation complete.

> > -- create a copy of the data so we can put it back after deletes
> > create table np001backup like np001;

--- SQL operation complete.

> > insert into np001backup select \* from np001;

--- 16384 row(s) inserted.

> > obey TEST001(plans);
> > 
> > -- turn off query caching
> > -- so we can see effects of particular selectivities
> > cqd query_cache '0';

--- SQL operation complete.

> > explain options 'f' delete from np001 where a = 1025;

---

.    .    1    trafodion_delete                NP001                 1.00E+000

--- SQL operation complete.

> > obey TEST001(crossover);
> > 
> > -- perform some DELETEs and measure the time taken, compare with
> > -- the plans generated
> > 
> > -- what we see is that as the cardinality increases, we switch from
> > -- doing index access scan to a full table scan
> > 
> > -- we will also see that the execution times are about the same for
> > -- both plans in the neighborhood of the cross over; however this has
> > -- to be taken with a grain of salt as these test results were done
> > -- on a VM with no controls over competing activity
> >

Looks good to me too.

Steve - can phoenix T2 tests be run separately for change (rather than wait till daily build ) ?

Suresh/Dave - I'll try and merge this once the tests finish.
Yes, jenkins is set up to request particular tests against particular Pull Request. I have started phoenix-T2 against this PR: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/phoenix_test_T2-cm5.3/1/console
I am assuming this delivery is ready to be merged now. Will do so in a couple of hours unless there is feedback.
Starting the merge. Looks like Steve's request to run T2 tests ran with a different build, hence seeing similar failures as reported earlier. Will check with daily builds.
Looks good to me too. Will wait some more to see if others would like to review.
All minor comments, except I'm concerned whether the QT variable change removes compiler debugger from check,daily, and release builds.

I will push some more changes that will:
   Simplify the TOOLSDIR check in sqenvcom.sh
   See if there is a simple solution to fixing the QT issue
   Mention that HIVE regression fail if TPC is not installed
   Fix the INSTALL_TPC check in install_local_hadoop and rework the output text
   Add a mkdir in the script if the tools directory does not exist

Create 2 JIRAs
- fix the dependency for TPC in order to run HIVE tests
- Add installation of QT and protobufs in the traf_tools_setup.sh script
I just pushed the requested.  I did not get any e-mail message for this push but it does show up in the pull request as a separate commit ...

The apache wiki site still refers Nv44 (while the old wiki.trafodion.org site refers Trf), this must be updated.
Look over all the 3rd party open source libs, ICU is the only one we adds suffix, I don't think this is necessary. And contributors from community might have ICU libs already on their system, and make them have another copy of the libs is not necessary. We better not to use any suffix anymore, although there might be works to update all our dev systems.
Can one of the committers verify this patch?
